description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8a85p","text":"This protocol results in the isolation of single nucleated zoospores from a culture of Aurantiochytrium limacinum.  The point is to recover single nucleus colonies rather than single cell colonies (which may contain varying nuclei - particularly following transformation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":87,"length":26,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"795ab","text":"Filtration Pump (or other way to pull a vacuum)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7033t","text":"Filter holder (mftr#: Thermo Scientific Nalgene 300-4000)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akabu","text":"5 um nylon filter (catalog#: R50SP04700)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kvuh","text":"15 ml culture tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mena","text":"GPY media (+ zeocin 100 ug/ml)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"839tn","text":" - 0.5% Yeast Extract, 1% Peptone, 3% D+-Glucose, 1.8% instant ocean ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fct9m","text":"GPY zeocin plate (+ zeocin 100 ug/ml + ampicilin 100 ug/ml)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d8k2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_affiliation: State University of New York at Stony Brook

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

keywords: filtration, zoospores, single colony, single nucleus, aurantiochytrium, thraustochytrids

authors_list.name: Mariana Rius
authors_list.affiliation: State University of New York at Stony Brook

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ofa6","text":"Inoculate 500 ul GPY media (microcentrifuge tube) with toothpick scrape of a colony. If inoculating a zeocin resistant colony, add 5 ul zeocin (for 100 ug\/ml). Vortex\/ resuspend cells. Pipette 4.5 ml of GPY into a 15 ml glass culture tube. Add 500 ul inoculum. Incubate at 28 C, 170 rpm for 48 h, or until microscopy reveals the presence of zoospores.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B02ED580DD5811E8916DA5E67EFFBD15","id":678482,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Prepare Culture"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhj8n","text":"Filter culture using a 5 um nylon filter membrane, nalgene filter holder, and filtration pump.Transfer flowthrough to a microcentrifuge tube and centrifuge 5 min 11000 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B0752D50DD5811E8916DA5E67EFFBD15","id":678483,"previous_id":678482,"previous_guid":"B02ED580DD5811E8916DA5E67EFFBD15","section":"Filter Culture"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s1j4","text":"Resuspend cell pellet in 100 ul of \u00bd Artificial Seawater (ASW) or media. Make a 10X dilution by adding 10 ul of cells to 90 ul of \u00bd ASW or media. Spread onto 2% agar GPY (+ zeocin +amp) plate. Incubate at 28 C for 48 - 72 h until colonies appear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B075A280DD5811E8916DA5E67EFFBD15","id":678484,"previous_id":678483,"previous_guid":"B0752D50DD5811E8916DA5E67EFFBD15","section":"Plate Zoospores"}
